situation.title: Other sports
situation.meta_description: Indoor sports grounds are now closed to amateur athletes and the public. Jogging is allowed in the park or in nature.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Amateur sports

Outdoor gyms, fitness centers and sport facilities stay open for the public (amateur sports) as well. Considering the ban on free movement, however, any amateur sport activity group is allowed to consist of 6 persons maximum only.  Outdoor gyms stay accessible and you are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask when carrying out your sports activity. However, you are urged to obey the strengthened hygienic rules, especially to keep a distance and to sanitize your hands regularly.

Running, jogging & other individual sport arts

Running/jogging is allowed in the open as well as on the way there. When carrying out a sports activity the obligation to wear a mask does not apply, although it is recommended to do so.

These regulations apply accordingly for other individual sport arts as well, meaning that it is still possible, for instance, to carry out an open air golf session. 

Professional sport

Professional sportsmen are exempted from the group size restriction as well as from the ban on access and using indoor sport facilities. The term "professional sportsman" regards a person whose sport activities constitute his/her employment, business or similar. Professional sportsmen are allowed to carry out sport activities in order to prepare themselves to upcoming events outdoor as well as indoor, regardless of the number of persons present.

Nevertheless, they must obey all valid hygienic regulations - especially regarding keeping a distance and sanitizing hands. When carrying out the sport activity itself, they are exempted from the obligation to wear a mask, but upon the end of a training unit, they have - according to valid regulations - to put their masks on again.
